On september 3, 2012
Colt1911

This is how I understand BiA: you can only have one Hero day at a time. If someone is already a Hero, you can't BiA them.

You'll see that if you look at the Epoqalypse. Residents who had one free Hero day in their counter, but could not spend the Hero day, were immune to further BiA unless they won LMS or bought themselves Hero days.

In other words, you can have only 1 BiA at a time.
So those 39 Heroes have to spend 39 days gifting that resident a Hero day.
On september 3, 2012
TailsTheeFox

Alright, thanks for letting me know. I was curious to how that worked. :3

Colt1911

I agree. But now I have a question.

Let's say there are 5 residents who are former heroes, and all of them have unlocked BiA.

Then a Hero gives resident1 a Hero day.

Can resident1 give the Hero day he is currently using to resident2, who can then give it to resident 3, and so on?
On september 3, 2012
jkudlick
Colt1911I agree. But now I have a question.Let's say there are 5 residents who are former heroes, and all of them have unlocked BiA.Then a Hero gives resident1 a Hero day.Can resident1 give the Hero day he is currently using to resident2, who can then give it to resident 3, and so on?

No. The BiA day is deducted from the Hero's balance, and it cannot be used on the Hero's last day (it cannot reduce the Hero's balance to 0).

jkudlick
alwaysmetaraShush, just shush, alright? Eh? You lie. You only have six.

A Letter to Father Christmas counts as an RP text, but does not grant a distinction. Also, if you find an RP text before Day 5 and you die that night, you don't get the distinction for it, either.

For example, I have found 12 RP texts, including the Father Christmas text, but I only have 10 distinctions. I found one of them while scavenging a few months ago on Day 3 or 4, then died that night when some numbskull opened the gates at 22:59. I was unhappy.

So, here's the story from the town I got my LMS in. BlackVoid's story of EpicOne day I checked in on town, back when I always checked RIGHT after the attack, and, lo and behold, I was one of the last few left in town. I realized later that I had a message and that someone was asking me if I could help them camp with their wife, because they were terrorized. I said sure and escorted them out, and camped that day I believe. Somewhere along this town I had become addicted and that was how they paid me back, by giving me a drug. Well after this day I had run out of drugs and I noticed there was ONE guy left at town. I decided "Hey, I got a shot at LMS here" and went back to town. When I logged back in the next day, either the other guy had left to camp or I had won the LMS through luck, I can't remember. Now, the guy who I escorted got stuck in his zone after a day or two and his wife had already died, so he couldn't do anything except camp. So, the funny thing is, I looked back and saw, his comment on town and it said "Hey! Nobody told me you had to be in town to get LMS!" I'm certain I fudged some details, but it's how I remembered it.

Happy for you, blind man, who see nothing of women!

Ah, if you saw what I see you would be sick even as I am.

Would God I had been blind before I saw her curling hair, her white flanked splendid snowy body; ah, my life is distressful to me.

I pitied blind men until my peril grew beyond all sorrow, I have changed my pity, though pitiful, to envy; I am ensnared by the maid of the curling locks.

Alas for him who has seen her, and alas for him who does not see her every day; alas for those trapped in her love, and alas for those who are set free!

Alas for him who goes to meet her, and alas for him who does not meet her always, alas for him who was with her, and alas for him who is not with her!

-Irish, Uilliam Ruadh; 16th Century

On january 23, 2014
Blaire

Certain Distinctions.

To be more specific, I, on the strength of 7 Hero Days left over from the Facebook Caption Contest, went to a small town known as Nasty Holes of Rage with 4 companions in tow. 2tousent Gunter Vaniglia and yungching. Vaniglia was busy with German shenanigans and died night 1 due to forgetting/ being busy. Yungching had to suicide for a meta jump a few days in. Gunter had computer problems, and if he had gotten his computer up 25 minutes earlier than he had and signed in to drink a water ration, would have made it when we constructed the Giant BRD. 2tousent made it nearly as long as I did. We still have one Zen Camper, a new player by the name of KyraEmett. We started out pretty decently and only got better. These new players' commitment to the town exceeds by far average: we once had a day where we had to have 6 people get on watch, when we had only 15 people left, and only 10 of those without watch-harmful statuses (Infected, wounded, hungover, Hooked, etc.), and we still managed to get them all on and cover it in an orderly manner. To be honest, at the beginning of the day, I looked at our items in the Bank and thought, "There's no way we can cover watch tonight". However, we banded together and managed it. We built a BRD. We held onto the town 'til day 10 despite having only one Guardian who lasted more than a day (that was me), and only 2 Heroes overall who made it past 1 day. I managed to get 3 absolutely new players to enter an IRC chat, where I coordinated an 8-10 AP trip through 5-8 zombie zones, so that we could get into optimum (well decent, but you know) Zen Camping chances. We have survived well beyond what might be expected from a town primarily composed of new players. And of course, the biggest win of all; I got more zombie kills in one town than yungching has in all their towns .

Iced Guardian

I don't think anyone has to instantly start harming the town just because turned a ghoul. A ghoul is not necessarily an enemy. There are cooperative and dangerous ones. It's true that most ends up messing the town by eating heroes and/or active and experienced players first to assure the newbs won't catch him. That's a valid surviving strategy, part of the game as it doesn't take things to the personal level.

But stepping from watch to screw the town just because you're mad with particular individuals has nothing to do with ghoul business. That's just griefing, plain and simple.

I can't stand for people (not you, I mean generally) that makes the whole town/crew/meta pay for a personal grudge or anger directed towards anyone. I mean, come on, it's a cooperative game and there's people spending real time and money on it. If you have personal issues, even if it's with more than 1 player, don't be a spoiled brat by freaking out blowing the whole thing out because of that. Just play cool, die when your time comes and set your business directly with whomever you have to.
Like a grown up.

Sorry if I sound conceited, but it really bugs me as I've seen such behavior causing serious problems in this game.
